metadata.feature_description: Manage different page types including normal, template, and special pages

steps.action: Click Add Page button from Pages panel
steps.expected: Add Page form appears with page type options
steps.actual: Add Page form appeared with Standard, Existing, URL, File page type options

steps.action: Enter page name 'Test Normal Page' with Standard type selected
steps.expected: Page name is entered and page appears in tree
steps.actual: Page name entered successfully and preview appeared in page tree

steps.action: Click Add Page button to save
steps.expected: Normal page is created and displayed
steps.actual: Page created successfully, redirected to new page with edit mode enabled, page appeared in navigation menu

steps.action: Click Save Page Template dropdown and select Evoq Page Template
steps.actual: Template creation form appeared with Template Name and Description fields

steps.action: Enter template name 'Test Template Page' and click Save
steps.expected: Template is created and appears in templates list
steps.actual: Template created successfully and displayed in Page Templates panel alongside existing 'Cavalier - Main' template

steps.action: View page type options on existing page
steps.expected: Page type selector shows available types
steps.actual: Page type selector displayed with Standard, Existing, URL, File options. Standard was selected for normal page.

steps.action: Change page type from Standard to URL
steps.expected: Form updates to show URL-specific fields
steps.actual: Form updated to show URL input field, Permanent Redirect toggle, and Open Link In New Window toggle. Thumbnail changed to redirect icon.

steps.action: Navigate to Advanced tab > More section
steps.actual: Security section found with Secure Connection and Disable Page toggles

steps.expected: Toggle switches to On state and Save button becomes enabled
steps.actual: Disable Page toggle switched to On, Save button became enabled, 'Changes have not been saved' message appeared

observations: Page types available in UI: Standard (normal), Existing (redirect to existing page), URL (external redirect), File (file download)
Template pages are created via 'Save Page Template' button which saves current page as reusable template
The 'Disable Page' option is located in Advanced > More > Security section, not as a page type
According to code review, pages with type other than 'normal' or 'template', or with DisableLink enabled, are published immediately with Direct Publish workflow
